channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

item.title: Report E-2025010182
item.description:
Report E-2025010182

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 14, 2025, four (4) 1-gallon pails of paint were punctured and released approximately 8-ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2025010656
item.description:
Report X-2025010656

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-10
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the ATLRT location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. While investigating the fiberboard box the spill agent found three plastic jugs inside with styrofoam packing peanuts for dunnage. The jugs contained UN3082 and all had class 9 labels but the outer packaging did not have any DG markings or paperwork. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.

item.title: Report I-2025010011
item.description:
Report I-2025010011

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-06
  • City: Ellijay
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PVS Transportation driver was scheduled to deliver a shipment of Ferric Chloride to Pilgrims Pride. He was filling the tank and was 450 gallons from the tank being full on the gaging system when it begin to overflow into containment. The driver was watching the offload and immediately shut down the transfer of materials. Approximately 20 gallons of Ferric Chloride Solution overflowed and 100% of it was contained in the containment at the site. There were no injuries or exposes during the release.
